alert.note: Alert for Chautauqua; Genesee; Northern Erie; Southern Erie; Wyoming (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 25 at 1:18PM EST by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...A BAND OF HEAVY LAKE EFFECT SNOW BAND WILL AFFECT THE BUFFALO SOUTH TOWNS AND WESTERN PORTIONS OF GENESEE AND WYOMING COUNTIES... HAZARDS...A lake effect snow band accompanied by winds of up to 35 MPH which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than a quarter of a mile. This lake effect snow band is producing extremely heavy snow at the rate of 2 inches per hour. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 114 PM EST, the band extended from Silver Creek, across Hamburg, East Aurora, and Attica. The band will remain nearly stationary through 3 p.m. LOCATIONS IMPACTED INCLUDE... Buffalo, West Seneca, Lackawanna, Hamburg, East Aurora, Darien Lakes State Park, Evans, Elma, Boston, Eden, Marilla, Bennington, Colden, Orchard Park, Silver Creek, Alden, Blasdell, Attica, Angola and North Collins. This includes Interstate 90 between exits 55 and 58. SAFETY INFO... Travel in this band will be extremely difficult. The snow will accumulate so rapidly that it will be extremely difficult for the road crews to keep the roads clear. Blowing and drifting snow will lower visibility below a quarter mile in this band. &&

area.areaDesc: Chautauqua; Genesee; Northern Erie; Southern Erie; Wyoming
